headline: General Motors to halt funding for robotaxis as part of Cruise restructuring
summary: Investing.com -- General Motors Company (NYSE:GM) climbed in afterhours trading Tuesday after the automaker announced that it would halt funding to produce robotaxis, refocussing efforts to develop autonomous driving on personal vehicles in a move that could significantly lower its spending.

raw.headline: General Motors to halt funding for robotaxis as part of Cruise restructuring

headline: GM to exit loss-making Cruise robotaxi business
summary: (Reuters) -General Motors said on Tuesday it will end robotaxi development at its majority-owned, money-losing Cruise business, a blow to the ambitions of the largest U.S. automaker which had made the advanced technology unit a top priority.  The automaker has invested more than $10 billion in Cruise since 2016.  Cruise will be folded into its group working on driver assistance technology.

headline: Morgan Stanley ups GM rating, Tesla target
summary: Investing.com -- Morgan Stanley upgraded General Motors (NYSE:GM) to Equal-Weight in a note Tuesday and raised its price target for the stock to $54 a share, citing improved fundamentals and strategic adjustments in its operations.
